fields.title: Markov and Chebyshev inequalities
fields.pointers:
*  [Chernoff bounds](chernoff_bounds)  are another method for bounding the probability of extreme values.
* The inequality can be  [extended to higher-order moments](chebyshev_inequality_higher_order) .
* Chebyshev's bound can be used to prove the  [weak law of large numbers](weak_law_of_large_numbers) .
fields.summary: Markov's inequality and Chebyshev's inequality are tools for bounding the probability of a random variable taking on extreme values. While the bounds are weak, they apply under very general conditions. One use of Chebyshev's inequality is to prove the weak law of large numbers.
